basics.name: Guillermo Roman
basics.label: Electrical Engineer. Software Developer
basics.summary: **Software Developer with over 5 years of experience specializing in Java, Identity, Access Control, IT and Software Architecture.** Passionate, self-motivated, quick learner, interested in elegant technology that can solve real-world problems. Guillermo loves spending time exploring the world, playing soccer, and having picnics at the lake shore (weather permitting)

work.summary: Worked as an I&AM consultant for various clients designing and implementign authentication and authorization systems, and performing application integration and security engineering on multiple high availability, fault tolerant infrastructures.
highlights: Lead developer for OpenConnect, a mobile I&AM platform that provides SSO multiple mobile and web-based apps. Developed the product in over 1 year and implemented open standards such as OAuth2.0, OpenID Connect, and SAML 2.0
Main maintainer of the company's SVN repository utilized by 10 developers
Provided 4-week training course for new employees
Main administrator for several Unix and Windows systems

work.summary: Desgined and implemented a centralized Universal Identity Management (UIM) system to provide access control, single-sign on, and user self-service features for over 8 million users.
highlights: Developed REST Endpoints that were consumed by an AunglarJS front-end that allowed the company to streamlined the legacy authentication flows
Automated platform deployment using CI pipeline based on Maven, Stash, Jenkins, RPM, and uDeploy
Developed several custom authentication modules in Java to enable features such as 2FA, or Remeber Me
Designed Multi-Factor Authentication Architecture that protected customer against account takeover attacks
Migrated over 8 million identities in less than 10 hours using a data sycnrhonization pipeline between Microsoft SQL and LDAP

work.summary: Designed and implemented Verizon's access management, single-sign-on, and user management systems that provide services to over 60 million customers.
highlights: Integrated Oracle's Real-time Risks Analysis Engine into the companie's authentication flows. The engine detects suspicious login activity and reacts in accordance to the level of risk
Designed a 2-Factor Authentication solution using OTPs delivered via SMS and/or Email
Implemented a Mobile I&AM platform that provides SSO between mobile and web apps for 10 million devices
Developed User Self-Service backend using Spring MVC that runs on three active datacenters

work.summary: Designed and implemented an Identity Gateway based on SAML 2.0. The platform provides integration between third party service providers such as Google Apps, or Office 365 and several New York State school districts
highlights: Developed in Java multiple SAML 2.0 plugings to simplify the authentication process for students and teachers
Implemented in Javascript a district finder page that allowed students to easily access their district's applications

references.name: Rishiraj Singh
references.reference: Jane is awesome! I'd hire her again in a heartbeat.
